title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 503.3 - Witnesses and subpoenas
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 503.3 - Witnesses and subpoenas

State Regulations
(a) Upon the
application of any party or representatives of a party a subpoena or a subpoena
duces tecum may be signed and issued by the commissioner or by a duly
designated employee of the department authorized to conduct the proceeding
wherein the subpoena is requested. Written application for subpoenas duces
tecum must be submitted at least five days prior to a hearing, setting forth
the papers desired to be produced and the reasons why they are necessary in the
conduct of the proceeding. (b) Any
attorney may issue a subpoena as provided in section 304 of the State

Administrative Procedure Act. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
503.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
